channel.title: Calling Class.newInstance()
channel.description:
Aight, so I'm having a little trouble getting my new b0t to run in a tabbed pane. When I call Class.newInstance:
[code]Applet applet = (Applet)AccessorMethods.getMainClass().newInstance();[/code]
and then call it again to add another RS frame to the tabbed pane, I get error_game_alreadyloaded (huh). Client throws this when the reference to applet_sub1 isn't null, so calling Class.newInstance isn't creating a totally new client? WTFHELP PLSThX[br][size=1]Posted at: August 27, 2006, 09:35:34 PM[/size][hr]By the way, (Applet)new client(); doesn't make any difference. ;'|

item.title: Calling Class.newInstance()
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“NOURLOL, post:18, topic:11361”]o hai der guys!
It’s not possible to run 2 applet instances without putting them in sandboxes (threadgroups?) of sorts.[/quote]
good point, ok we are going to need threads. but guys remeber
NOURLOL’s brother (regex) demands that the applicaiton be one thread and simply jump around so your going to have to hack the rs client and in between one loop call the loop of the other applets. ALSO whatver you do dont tell him that runescape is more than one thread. plz dont!

Read full topic

item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:13, topic:11361”]Applet applet2 = …

would probably have worked too?[/quote]
no becuase many parts of the client are static therfore a “new client()” would still refrence parts of the first client.

Read full topic

item.title: Calling Class.newInstance()
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

this should help you

public static URLClassLoader newInstance(final URL[] urls,
final ClassLoader parent) {
// Save the caller’s context
AccessControlContext acc = AccessController.getContext();
// Need a privileged block to create the class loader
URLClassLoader ucl =
(URLClassLoader) AccessController.doPrivileged(new PrivilegedAction() {
public Object run() {
return new FactoryURLClassLoader(urls, parent);
}
});
// Now set the context on the loader using the one we saved,
// not the one inside the privileged block…
ucl.acc = acc;
return ucl;
}

public static URLClassLoader newInstance(final URL[] urls) {
// Save the caller’s context
AccessControlContext acc = AccessController.getContext();
// Need a privileged block to create the class loader
URLClassLoader ucl = (URLClassLoader)
AccessController.doPrivileged(new PrivilegedAction() {
public Object run() {
return new FactoryURLClassLoader(urls);
}
});

// Now set the context on the loader using the one we saved,
// not the one inside the privileged block…
ucl.acc = acc;
return ucl;
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Calling Class.newInstance()
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Ruler figured it out for me. I had the runescape.jar in my runtime classpath, and when I took it out and used a URLClassLoader to load the class remotely it worked.

Read full topic

item.title: Calling Class.newInstance()
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

test.setText("downloading http://" + theServer.prefix + ".runescape.com/runescape.jar"); URLClassLoader loader = new URLClassLoader( new URL[] { new URL("http://" + theServer.prefix + ".runescape.com/runescape.jar") }); bar.setSelection(1); test.setText("loading http://" + theServer.prefix + ".runescape.com/runescape.jar"); Class c = loader.loadClass("client"); Applet tempApplet = (Applet) c.newInstance(); bar.setSelection(2); test.setText("starting client"); tempApplet.setStub(new OurAppletStub(theServer.prefix, theServer.worldNumber, theServer.memebers)); tempApplet.start(); tempApplet.init(); bar.setSelection(3); [br][size=1]Posted at: August 28, 2006, 01:33:03 AM[/size][hr][quote=“Pwnd, post:8, topic:11361”]Ruler, may I ask if you know what you’re talking about?[/quote]
newbie

Read full topic
